title: Installation issue: caliper on NERSC Cori
body:
Using `spack@develop` (3-Aug, 4c97a0ea1cbcb42fff4cb2183552b6b6c441d791) on **NERSC Cori** (`cray-cnl7-haswell`) with `%intel@19.1.1.217`:

The Spack environment used to install `caliper` is attached below along with the full build log.

```
$> spack -e . install
...
==> Installing caliper
Note: checking out '30577b4b8beae104b2b35ed487fec52590a99b3d'.

You are in 'detached HEAD' state. You can look around, make experimental
changes and commit them, and you can discard any commits you make in this
state without impacting any branches by performing another checkout.

If you want to create a new branch to retain commits you create, you may
do so (now or later) by using -b with the checkout command again. Example:

  git checkout -b <new-branch-name>

==> caliper: Executing phase: 'cmake'
==> caliper: Executing phase: 'build'
...
  >> 746    ": internal error: ** The compiler has encountered an unexpected problem.
     747    ** Segmentation violation signal raised. **
```
